title: what prevents from accessing the site https://www.googleadservices.com/
content:
Regardless of the OS or Browser , trying to access the site https://www.googleadservices.com/ results with a failure described as "We canâ€™t connect to the server at www.googleadservices.com."

Specifically this error message was just obtained on macOS Ventura 13.1 on my Intel based MacBook Pro using Firefox 109.0.1. It happens on all Windows machines I tried, on my iPad and iPhone.

I saw at least a million similar questions similar to this one, even more advices on how to address it - and no answer helps.
creator: nik23

title: I can't delete emails
content: In my yahoo email, I can't delete emails.
creator: cenzina4

title: Please... Make It Stop
content: It keeps asking me to UPDATE and I keep clicking DISMISS. I want to turn off update checking. I keep asking for this feature to be restored, and no one is listening. It seems to me that what we want as users no longer matters anymore. I DO NOT WANT Firefox TO CHECK FOR UPDATES. I don't like being nagged.
creator: Pete12345

title: I'm signed in to my Firefox account on multiple desktop computers. Where are my containers?
content:
Do containers not sync? I don't see any explicit option to include them in the sync settings. I have "add-ons" and "settings" checked. One computer has the correct containers and the rest have the default set (personal, shopping, etc.). Sync is otherwise working correctly.

In response to early replies I realized I left out some detail in my question.

- I have sync enabled in the extension settings. - This is a continuous problem (the containers from one browser have never synced with the others, over many months) so I don't think it's just a time delay issue.

Thanks for your responses.
creator: k3davis1

title: problem login to some website
content:
1. I am getting the following error while login into one of the website using Firefox: 

     We're sorry, an error occurred while accessing this site. Please try again later.  I can login using Edge browser. It is happening in last couple of days.

2. I am getting the 'Something went wrong, please try again' error while trying to order something with PayPal payment. 

       The screen blinks for a moment and than I get the error message.     Last time it happened when ordering something from Staples.com    It was ok when used Edge browser.

title: I changed a password but don't know what the mask did or maybe that wasn't the problem. but my email provider doesn't let me in
content: I can't get to them. it's an email provider called tutanota it's encrypted email. I just changed the password and didn't save it in firefox so what is stored there is the old one. I changed that about 2 hours ago but I don't know if that mask creator created some other info or what and now I can't access my email. can you help me? they don't have support for free users. please, I can't lose that account, I use it for work
